medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 year earlier, with episodes of transient confusion, dizziness, tremors, and anxiety. These episodes occurred unpredictably, lasted for minutes before gradual recovery, and increased in frequency over the year. The patient felt well between episodes and also experienced spells of double vision that had a sudden onset, often independent of other symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Myocardial infarction treated with stent placement in the left anterior descending coronary artery, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, mild chronic renal insufficiency, benign colonic polyps.
medical_history.family_history: Two daughters are healthy; two sisters have coronary artery disease; one sister has rectal cancer; one uncle has diabetes.
medical_history.social_history: Retired, lives alone, capable of performing daily activities independently; does not smoke or consume alcohol.
